net.fathomsoft.nova.tree

Class SyntaxTree

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.fathomsoft.nova.tree.SyntaxTree

  • public class SyntaxTree
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that deconstructs a source code file and builds a Tree out of the statements.
    Since:
    v0.1 Jan 5, 2014 at 9:00:15 PM
    Version:
    v0.2.21 Jul 30, 2014 at 1:45:00 PM
    Author:
    Braden Steffaniak

    • Constructor Detail

      • SyntaxTree

        public SyntaxTree(java.io.File[] files,
                  Nova controller)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Create a SyntaxTree instance from the source code in the specified File.
        Parameters:
        files - The files containing the Foxy source code.
        controller - The controller of the compiling program.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if there was an error finding the files or reading from it.

      • SyntaxTree

        public SyntaxTree(java.io.File[] files,
                  java.lang.String[] sources,
                  Nova controller)
        Generate a SyntaxTree instance given the name of the file and the source within it.
        Parameters:
        files - The files containing the Foxy source code.
        sources - The source codes inside the files.
        controller - The controller of the compiling program.

    • Method Detail

      • getPhase

        public int getPhase()
        Get the phase that the SyntaxTree is generating in currently.
        • Phase 1: Decode imports and class headers
        • Phase 2: Decode fields, external types, and method declarations
        • Phase 3: Decode method contents
        Returns:
        The phase (1, 2, or 3) that the SyntaxTree is currently generating in.

      • getMainMethod

        public MethodDeclaration getMainMethod()
        Search for the main method, if one exists, in the compiling program. For more details on what the main method looks like, see SyntaxUtils.isMainMethod(BodyMethodDeclaration).
        Returns:
        The Method representation of the main method.

      • validateNodes

        public boolean validateNodes(Node root)
        Traverse through the tree and validate each node.
        Parameters:
        root - The Node to validate, then validate the children.

      • decodeStatement

        public static Node decodeStatement(Node parent,
                                   java.lang.String statement,
                                   Location location,
                                   java.lang.Class<?>[] types)
        Decode the specific statement into its correct Node value. If the statement does not translate into a Node, a syntax error has occurred.
        Parameters:
        parent - The Parent Node of the current statement to be decoded.
        statement - The statement to be decoded into a Node.
        location - The Location in the source text where the statement is located at.
        types - The types of Nodes to try to decode, in the given order.
        Returns:
        The Node constructed from the statement, if any.

      • decodeStatement

        public static Node decodeStatement(Node parent,
                                   java.lang.String statement,
                                   Location location,
                                   boolean require,
                                   java.lang.Class<?>[] types)
        Decode the specific statement into its correct Node value. If the statement does not translate into a Node, a syntax error has occurred.
        Parameters:
        parent - The Parent Node of the current statement to be decoded.
        statement - The statement to be decoded into a Node.
        location - The Location in the source text where the statement is located at.
        require - Whether or not to throw an error if anything goes wrong.
        types - The types of Nodes to try to decode, in the given order.
        Returns:
        The Node constructed from the statement, if any.

      • decodeStatementOfType

        public static Node decodeStatementOfType(Node parent,
                                         java.lang.String statement,
                                         Location location,
                                         boolean require,
                                         java.lang.Class<?> type)
        Decode the specific statement into its correct Node value. If the statement does not translate into a Node, a syntax error has occurred.
        Parameters:
        parent - The Parent Node of the current statement to be decoded.
        statement - The statement to be decoded into a Node.
        location - The Location in the source text where the statement is located at.
        require - Whether or not to throw an error if anything goes wrong.
        type - The type of Node to try to decode.
        Returns:
        The Node constructed from the statement, if any.

      • decodeVariable

        public static Node decodeVariable(Node parent,
                                  java.lang.String statement,
                                  Location location,
                                  boolean require,
                                  boolean declaration)
        Decode the specific statement into its correct Node value. If the statement does not translate into a Node, a syntax error has occurred.
        Parameters:
        parent - The Parent Node of the current statement to be decoded.
        statement - The statement to be decoded into a Node.
        location - The Location in the source text where the statement is located at.
        require - Whether or not to throw an error if anything goes wrong.
        declaration - Whether or not to search for a declaration type.
        Returns:
        The Node constructed from the statement, if any.

      • decodeScopeContents

        public static Node decodeScopeContents(Node parent,
                                       java.lang.String statement,
                                       Location location)
        Decode a String that was found within a scope. That is, a method or scopes within a method: for loops, while loops, if statements, etc.
        Parameters:
        parent - The parent node of the current statement to decode.
        statement - The statement to decode.
        location - The location of the statement.
        Returns:
        The Node representation of the given statement.

      • decodeScopeContents

        public static Node decodeScopeContents(Node parent,
                                       java.lang.String statement,
                                       Location location,
                                       boolean require)
        Decode a String that was found within a scope. That is, a method or scopes within a method: for loops, while loops, if statements, etc.
        Parameters:
        parent - The parent node of the current statement to decode.
        statement - The statement to decode.
        location - The location of the statement.
        require - Whether or not to throw an error if anything goes wrong.
        Returns:
        The Node representation of the given statement.

      • decodeIdentifier

        public static Identifier decodeIdentifier(Node parent,
                                          java.lang.String statement,
                                          Location location)
        If you see this method, then I have failed you.
        Parameters:
        parent - The parent node of the current statement to decode.
        statement - The statement to decode.
        location - The location of the statement.
        Returns:
        The Identifier representation of the given statement.

      • getUsableExistingNode

        public static Variable getUsableExistingNode(Node parent,
                                             java.lang.String statement,
                                             Location location)
        Try to find an existing node from the given statement. This method searches through fields and local variables.
        Parameters:
        parent - The parent Node to use as our context.
        statement - The statement to check for an existing node from.
        location - The location of the newly generated usable variable.
        Returns:
        The Identifier that is found, if any.

      • findDeclaration

        public static VariableDeclaration findDeclaration(Node parent,
                                                  java.lang.String statement)
        Try to find an existing Node's declaration from the given statement. This method searches through fields and local variables.
        Parameters:
        parent - The parent Node to use as our context.
        statement - The statement to check for an existing declaration from.
        Returns:
        The VariableDeclaration that is found, if any.

      • decodeValue

        public static Value decodeValue(Node parent,
                                java.lang.String statement,
                                Location location,
                                boolean require)
        Decode the given statement into a Value Node.

        For example: 
         tree.children.add(new Node())
        The above expression would be returned in a Value Node.
        Parameters:
        parent - The parent of the statement to decode.
        statement - The statement to decode as a Value Node.
        location - The location in the source where this statement is.
        require - Whether or not to throw an error if anything goes wrong.

      • generateCHeaderOutput

        public void generateCHeaderOutput()
        Generate the C Header output from the data contained within the syntax tree.

      • generateCSourceOutput

        public void generateCSourceOutput()
        Generate the C Source output from the data contained within the syntax tree.

      • generateCOutput

        public void generateCOutput()
        Generate the C Source and Header output from the data contained within the syntax tree.

      • formatCHeaderOutput

        public void formatCHeaderOutput()
        Format the C Header output to follow syntactical rules.

      • formatCSourceOutput

        public void formatCSourceOutput()
        Format the C Source output to follow syntactical rules.

      • formatCOutput

        public void formatCOutput()
        Format the C Header and Source output to follow syntactical rules.

      • getCHeaderOutput

        public java.lang.String[] getCHeaderOutput()
        Get the C Header output text (destination text) from the Syntax tree.
        Returns:
        The C Header output text after compilation.

      • getCSourceOutput

        public java.lang.String[] getCSourceOutput()
        Get the C Source output text (destination text) from the Syntax tree.
        Returns:
        The C Source output text after compilation.

      • getFiles

        public FileDeclaration[] getFiles()
        Get the filenames of all the files, in order of the way they are in the tree structure
        Returns:
        The filenames of all the files, in order of the way they are in the tree structure.

      • getRoot

        public Program getRoot()
        Get the root Program of the tree. The root of the Syntax tree will be a Program.
        Returns:
        The root Program instance.

      • addFile

        public void addFile(FileDeclaration file)
        Add the given FileDeclaration to the SyntaxTree.
        Parameters:
        file - The FileDeclaration to add.

      • test

        public static java.lang.String test()
        Test the SyntaxTree class type to make sure everything is working properly.
        Returns:
        The error output, if there was an error. If the test was successful, null is returned.
